title: Paint House III
content:
There is a row of  houses in a small city, each house must be painted with one of the  colors (labeled from 1 to ), some houses that has been painted last summer should not be painted again.
A neighborhood is a maximal group of continuous houses that are painted with the same color. (For example: houses = [1,2,2,3,3,2,1,1] contains 5 neighborhoods  [{1}, {2,2}, {3,3}, {2}, {1,1}]).
Given an array , an  matrix  and an integer  where:

: is the color of the house , 0 if the house is not painted yet.
: is the cost of paint the house  with the color .

Return the minimum cost of painting all the remaining houses in such a way that there are exactly  neighborhoods, if not possible return -1.
